reviewText: overview of Israel's wars. informative, but just a superficial overview. contains nothing new to anyone who is already familiar with the wars.
In an effort to cover a wide spectrum of time and events, this DVD is a little thin in spots. Understanding that it is an overview, makes this more appreciated.
The tough history of Israel's wars is brought to you in 2 fascinating hours. As a history fan, this DVD is an asset to my collection.

Israel's War History This documentary is telling what I have always wanted to know about the famous Israel's war history. When you read or watch things about the Israel-Arab conflict you can sometimes find yourself confused of the conflictive reports, This film will make some order in this chaos.

The DVD arrived but wouldn't play.  I tried it in two different DVD players but it didn't work in either.  I am returning for a refund. If I have issues receiving my refund, I will update this to include that information as well.
I did enjoy this documentary.  I would buy it and keep it but read, "O Jerusalem" instead.
Many will check rate it as 5, but it was disappointing to me.  The rapid exchange of views was unsettling.  It didn't come through as a documentary.
Very well written and produced.  Accurate details.

This is poorly written and edited. It has an oddly inconsistent tone, as if it were patched together from various sources, without any overriding theme or approach. It's only real value, for someone like me who is very familiar with this history, are the occasional fascinating photos or film clips that I've never seen before.
The history was very informative.  There's a lot i didn't know about the how and why of Israel which was all answered in this movie.  Enjoyable for the history buff who likes to learn via film.
Very interesting documentary. This actually gives you the real story of Israel and not the pro-Palestinian bias usually shown.  Well worth your time.

If you are looking to figure out Israel's miraculous survival through the centuries, looking into the recent history of their reemergence as a nation with films like this can help a person understand that they are truly "God's Chosen People".

This is one of the best documentaries about Israel's continuing fight for survival out there. I have already watched it several times and would recommend it to anyone interested in the history of modern Israel.
